title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package directions.
While pasta cooks, crisp pancetta in a pan.
Whisk eggs, grated Pecorino, and plenty of black pepper in a bowl.
Drain pasta, reserving some pasta water. Add hot pasta to pancetta pan.
Remove pan from heat. Quickly add egg mixture, stirring vigorously. Add pasta water if needed to create a creamy sauce.
Serve immediately with extra Pecorino and black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
instructions: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili, turmeric, and garam masala for at least 1 hour.
Grill or bake chicken until cooked through and slightly charred.
In a large pan, melt butter. Add crushed tomatoes and cook until sauce thickens.
Stir in cooked chicken and heavy cream. Simmer for 10-15 minutes.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

title: Vegetable Stir Fry
summary: A quick and healthy meal with assorted vegetables and a savory sauce.
ingredients: Mixed vegetables (broccoli, carrots, bell peppers, snap peas)
instructions: Combine soy sauce, oyster sauce, sesame oil, broth, and cornstarch in a bowl for the sauce.
Heat oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds.
Add harder vegetables (broccoli, carrots), stir-fry for 3-4 minutes.
Add softer vegetables (bell peppers, snap peas), stir-fry for 2-3 minutes.
Pour in the sauce and cook until thickened, stirring constantly.
Serve immediately over rice or noodles.

title: Classic Beef Lasagna
summary: Layers of pasta, rich meat sauce, and creamy béchamel, baked to perfection.
instructions: Cook lasagna noodles according to package directions; drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, brown ground beef with onion and garlic; drain fat.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15-20 minutes.
In a separate bowl, combine ricotta cheese, egg, and Parmesan cheese.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Spread a thin layer of meat sauce in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Arrange 3 lasagna noodles over the sauce. Spread half of the ricotta mixture over the noodles, then top with a layer of meat sauce and a third of the mozzarella.
Repeat layers. Top with remaining noodles, sauce, and mozzarella.
Bake for 30 minutes, or until bubbly and cheese is melted and lightly browned. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

title: Tomato Basil Soup
summary: A comforting and flavorful soup made with ripe tomatoes and fresh basil.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion and cook until softened, about 5-7 minutes.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute more until fragrant.
Stir in crushed tomatoes and vegetable broth. Bring to a simmer.
Reduce heat, cover, and let it cook for 15-20 minutes.
Remove from heat, stir in fresh basil. Use an immersion blender (or carefully transfer to a regular blender) to blend until smooth.
Stir in heavy cream if desired. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, perhaps with a grilled cheese sandwich.
